quote: I raced as best as I could on the day, something I can always guarantee. I was very keen to make sure that if anyone wanted the title they would still have to work bloody hard for it!

By 10km in I'm getting cramp in my VMO muscles now, and feeling very sore, so a bit frustrated by this... The downhill was hard with fatigue quite high and very sore muscles and lack of coordination... On the final single track flats Robbie pulls away and my own pace was not actually that good.
NOTE: You think Ironman's hard? This is hard... The challenge with the Coast to Coast is the unknowns - what the conditions that are going to be like on the day. You can have 30 degrees.
Winning my category. The fact that I actually won, is like getting the whole cake and eating it cherries and all!

Use more GurneyGoo. For those of you who don't know what it is, it's the ultimate secret weapon for anyone competing in adventure races! GurneyGoo will prevent blisters, chafing, and prune foot – basically a Coast to Coast competitors best friend.
They are among the 700 athletes participating in the two-day events, embarking on a 55-kilometre bike ride from Kūmara Beach on the South Island's West Coast.
